ygData.subject: Re: Monster level
ygData.msgSnippet: Conning white being an even fight, that makes sense that the opponent is the same level as you.  I asked because people were saying they had never had a spell
ygData.messageBody:
Conning white being an even fight, that makes sense that the opponent is the
same level as you. I asked because people were saying they had never had a
spell damage an opponent that was "6 levels above them" and wondered how
they could figure that so precisely. But maybe it was NPCs and not monsters
they were fighting. I lost the original post.

----- Original Message -----
From: Karl Hatteland <karlh@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, May 08, 1999 11:46 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Monster level


> From: "Karl Hatteland" <karlh@...>
>
> Every thing that cons black/white to you are the same lvl as you.
>
> Avari darkelf wiz lvl 9 fenin ro
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cristie <cristie@...>
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> Date: Saturday, May 08, 1999 8:07 PM
> Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Monster level
>
>
> >From: Cristie <cristie@...>
> >
> >As I understand it, there is no tried and true way to get the exact
> >level. Monster levels are not the same as player levels from what I
> >read. You can gage it by what kind of monsters you can take on and make
an
> >estimation from there. Of course moss snakes and the like are level
1..all
> >the newbie stuff. I hear that the Ogre guards in Najena are around level
> >20 or something.. but that is just word of mouth that has passed that
> >along, I haven't read anything official to this end.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >At 10:37 AM 5/8/99 -0700, you wrote:
> >>From: "Joe Wallace" <joew88@...>
> >>
> >>How can you tell what level a monster is?
> >>
